name: 10 Literary Wordwise Questions | Brain Teasers Trivia Quiz

questions.correct: The Little Prince & Le Petit Prince
questions.explanation:
The Little Prince & Le Petit Prince.

	Antoine de Saint-Exupéry's 1943 novel "The Little Prince" ("Le Petit Prince" in the original French) is one of only six single-volume books to have sold more than 100 millions copies.

The Catcher in the Rye.

	J.D. Salinger's 1951 classic novel "The Catcher in the Rye" has sold more than 65 million copies.

questions.explanation:
Watership Down.

	Richard Adams' 1972 story about the rabbits of "Watership Down" has sold more than 50 million copies.

questions.text: THE PATRIOT PATRIOT PATRIOT PATRIOT PATRIOT PATRIOT "PATRIOT"
questions.explanation:
The Last Patriot.

	"The Last Patriot" is a counter-terrorism novel by Brad Thor. It topped the New York Times Bestseller List and was nominated for "Best Thriller of 2008".

questions.text: The STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY STORY to infinity
questions.explanation:
The Neverending Story.

	Michael Ende's 1979 novel "The Neverending Story" was originally published in German under the title "Die unendliche Geschichte".

Life of Pi.

	Yann Martel's 2001 novel "Life of Pi" was adapted for an award-winning 2012 Ang Lee film of the same name.

Breaking Dawn.

	Published in 2008, "Breaking Dawn" was the fourth and final installment of Stephenie Meyer's best-selling "The Twilight Saga" series.

Middlemarch & Decamerone & Decameron.

	George Eliot's classic novel "Middlemarch" was published in 1871.

Three Men in a Boat.

	Jerome K Jerome's comic travelogue "Three Men in a Boat" was published in 1889.

questions.text: L V R I O E
questions.explanation:
Oliver Twist.

	Published in 1838, "Oliver Twist" was the second novel by Charles Dickens. It was subtitled "The Parish Boy's Progress".
